table_talk.text:
I see that there's a lot of concern about Maria being potentially the Imp due to her silence. While I do understand the reasoning behind this suspicion, it seems premature to execute without more concrete evidence. Silence can indeed be a tactic used by an Evil player to avoid drawing attention, but it could also mean Maria is simply strategizing or cautious.

Before we make any moves against Maria, perhaps we should focus on gathering more information. For instance, if anyone has received useful insights from their Night abilities that could help us identify the Imp or Poisoner, now would be a good time to share. 

I'm not inclined to vote for executing Maria at this point without further investigation. Instead, I think it might be wise to encourage open discussion and see if we can learn more about each other's roles through our interactions. Maybe someone else could take the lead in nominating a different player or proposing an action that would help us uncover more details about who is truly on our side.

Overall, my vote for execution would go towards Peter or Enrique instead—just as a way to shake things up and see how others react without directly targeting Maria yet. Let's focus on collaboration rather than confrontation until we're certain of someone's role.

What do you all think? Any suggestions on who might be the best person to nominate or what other steps we could take to get clearer insights into each other's allegiances?
